metadata.title: Thursday, 16th February, 2023
metadata.session: SECOND SESSION OF THE THIRTEENTH ASSEMBLY

parts: (a) when the Government will undertake a comprehensive rehabilitation of Kundamfumu Clinic in Chembe District; and
(b) what the cause of the delay in commencing the rehabilitation works, is.

questions.minister: Minister of Home Affairs and Internal Security
parts: (a) whether the Government has any plans to establish a border post between Zambia and Zimbabwe in Chief Chipepo’s area in Gwembe District;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented;
(c) what the estimated cost of the project is; and
(d) what the estimated time frame for the completion of the project, is.

questions.minister: Minister of Infrastructure, Housingand Urban Development
parts: (a) when the tarring of the Kabwe-Mukonchi-Luano road, under the Picaddily Road Project, will commence;
(b) what has caused the delay in commencing the Project;
(c) how many kilometres will be covered under the Project; and
(d) whether the project will include some township roads in Kabwe District.

questions.minister: Minister of Green Economy and Environment
parts: (a) why the Government issued licences to timber logging traders in the following areas in Chama District which form part of the Game Management Area, and are ecologically sensitive:
(i) Chifunda; (iv) Pondo; and (ii) Mapamba; (v) Fuluza; and (iii) Chikwa;
(b) whether there were any consultations on the matter between the Ministry of Green Economy and Environment and the Ministry of Tourism.

questions.minister: Minister of Infrastructure, Housing and Urban Development when the Government will construct palaces for the following Chiefs in Chama North Parliamentary Constituency
parts: (a) Mulilo;
(b) Chibale; and
(c) Lundu.
(a) whether there are any plans to connect Chishi Island in Chifunabuli Parliamentary Constituency to the national electricity grid;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented;
(c) when the project to connect power to the following areas in the Constituency will be completed:
(i) Shikamushile; (ii) Miponda; and (iii) Chombwe; and
(d) what the cause of the delay in completing the project is.

questions.minister: Minister of Technology and Science what measures the Government is taking to equip women and youths, countrywide, with technical skills.
Minister of Infrastructure, Housing and Urban Development
parts: (a) why the construction of classrooms at the following schools in Malole Parliamentary Constituency has stalled;
(i) a 1 x 2 classroom block at Chilombwa Primary School; and (ii) a 1 x 2 and a 1 x 3 classroom blocks at Mumba Primary school;
(b) when the projects will resume;
(c) what the time frame for the completion of each project is; and
(d) what the cost of the outstanding works on each project is.

questions.minister: Minister of Youth, Sport and Arts
parts: (a) whether the Government has any plans to construct a youth recreation centre in Mkaika Parliamentary Constituency; and
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented.
(a) whether the Government settled any court matters with other parties through consent judgments between August, 2021 to June, 2022;
(b) if so, what the total number of such cases was;
(c) of the total number of cases at (b) how many involved  compensating the complainants; and
